title: Particulate diagram - an alloy of Ni and B

content.question: Which of the following diagrams best depicts an alloy of Ni and B?

choices.label: A diagram shows 16 circles arranged to form a 4-by-4 grid. 6 smaller shaded circles are randomly distributed in gaps formed between these circles.
A diagram shows 16 molecules arranged to form a 4-by-4 grid. Each molecule comprises two adjacent circles, one of which is shaded.

A diagram shows 16 circles arranged to form a 4-by-4 grid. The following circles are shaded: the first and last circles in row 1, the second circle in row 2, the first circle in row 1, and the fourth circle in row 4.
A diagram shows alternating positive and negative ions arranged to form a 4-by-4 grid. Rows 1 and 3 begin with a negative ion, while rows 2 and 4 begin with a positive ion.

content.answer: A diagram shows 16 circles arranged to form a 4-by-4 grid. 6 smaller shaded circles are randomly distributed in gaps formed between these circles.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
